item.title: Thank You All!
item.description:
In the spirit of the holiday, I just want to say thank you to all the subscribers of Unpopular Front for (almost) one whole year. When I started this newsletter, I had been laid off from my job, was very unsure what I would do with my life and if I could make writing work as a career, and was frankly pretty scared. Even when you can find the means to ke‚Ä¶

URL: https://johnganz.substack.com/p/thank-you-all?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Today's State-of-the-Plague; & BRIEFLY NOTED: For 2021-11-26 Fr

item.title: Crypto
item.description:
Crypto has been around for a while now but it has, at long last, gone mainstream. A-list celebrities are hawking crypto stuff, crypto outfits are buying stadium naming rights, and you can bet good money there will be crypto ads running during the Super Bowl. It has thus become time, once again, to ask: is there anything to it, or is it all a huge scam? ‚Ä¶

URL: https://ryanavent.substack.com/p/crypto?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Today's State-of-the-Plague; & BRIEFLY NOTED: For 2021-11-26 Fr

item.title: Why Hawks Keep Getting Russia Wrong
item.description:
Jeff Hawn makes a persuasive case that Russia is not going to attack Ukraine: But is Russia actually about to attack Ukraine? The answer, based on the empirical evidence, seems to be a resounding no. These moves might be disturbing, especially given Russia‚Äôs history in Ukraine‚Äîbut they don‚Äôt presage war‚Ä¶

item.title: mmhmm and Phil Libin
item.description:
mmhmm is Phil Libin‚Äôs fifth startup and he learned a lot from the first four. One of those startups was Evernote, which he co-founded and led as CEO for 8 years. mmhmm started from a joke of an idea in May 2020 but quickly evolved into a real business with the launch of their closed beta in July, just two months later. Last week, exactly a year after th‚Ä¶

item.title: 'We want food!' Looting and riots rock Venezuela daily
item.description:
In May 2016, the numbers on my Venezuela Econ website showed the currency now weakened past 1,100 per dollar on the black market‚Äîand the streets were getting more and more hairy. Every few hours, we‚Äôd hear reports, from stringers, on social media, of crowds gathering and rioting, sometimes ransacking a market‚Ä¶

item.title: Starving Millions for 'Leverage' Is Evil
item.description:
Sarah Chayes has written what may be one of the most dastardly op-eds I have ever read. She warns against providing aid to Afghanistan too quickly because that would reduce Western ‚Äúleverage‚Äù over the Taliban: Western countries should not move too fast. Just because we‚Äôve failed to use our leverage in the past doesn‚Äôt mean we shouldn‚Äôt start now‚Ä¶

URL: https://daniellarison.substack.com/p/starving-millions-for-leverage-is?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

I would count this Substack as a modest success so far. With an email list of 36,000 and 3350 subscribers, it‚Äôs not one of the most widely read blogs out there, but I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs doing OK. That‚Äôs thanks to you, of course; I really hope you‚Äôve enjoyed it as much as I have so far, and I‚Äôm grateful to all of you for giving me the opportunity to be an indepe‚Ä¶

item.title: The most important election of our lifetime
item.description:
Every presidential election is described as the most important of our lifetime, and the 2024 race will be no exception. People mock this clich√©, but on some level, I think it does capture something significant ‚Äî because the United States pairs zero-sum non-proportional elections with a rising level of polarization in a two-party system, there really is ‚Ä¶
